title.narrative: 002. SOCIAL POLICIES FOR VULNERABLE CHIL

description.narrative: By the end of 2017, national and sub-national policies and strategies are strengthened to address identified vulnerabilities of children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Human Rights Institutions, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, boys and girls benefit from increased budget allocations under health, education, social welfare and protection addressing the needs of the most vulnerable.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2017, national and sub-national policies and strategies are strengthened to address identified vulnerabilities ofchildren.

description.narrative: Major contributions were provided in strengthening the social policy environment for children through technical and capacity support to improve policy frameworks (social protection, disabilities, local social planning), introduce key national programmes on social protection (MCCT), as well as through advocacy and capacity support for improved public finance for children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/12/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection

Methodology on child-sensitive local social plans developed. Scale: 0 (methodology not developed yet), 1(developing methodology), 2(finalizing methodology, consultation), 3 (methodology endorsed), 4 (methodology used)

Public financial management capacity in the MSWRR to support implementation of policies for vulnerable groups Scale: 0 (uneven PFM capacity), 1 (processes developed), 2 (processes used), 3 (strengthened PFM capacity)
